Networking

Class Networking

  • java.lang.Object
    • Networking.Networking
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class Networking
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable

    Enables communication of the whole application with player applications via local network. This communication uses both TCP and UDP protocols. TCP is used for direct communication with players (from this point of view moderator behaves like a typical TCP server). UDP is used for broadcasting data that the players need for establishing connection with server and information about the game.

    The communication protocol is described in documentation of CommonLib (see edu.cvut.vorobvla.bap.BapMessages).

    This class is implemented as a singleton.

      • setUpDefault

        public void setUpDefault()
                  throws java.lang.RuntimeException

      • setUpByInfceName

        public void setUpByInfceName(java.lang.String netIntfceName)
                      throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Sets netIntfce to a NetworkInterface object that represents network interface with specified name. Then finds the broadcast address of network connected with this interface and sets broadcastAddr to this address.
        Parameters:
        netIntfceName - the name of the interface connected to the network which is supposed to be used for communication.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - with message "Network interface setup failure" if a SocketException occurred (can be thrown by NetworkInterface.getByName()).

      • setModeratorPort

        public void setModeratorPort(int tcpModeratorPort)
                      throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Sets tcpModeratorPort to the specified value, initializes moderatorServerSocket with this port and initializes modServer with this socket. Then creates and starts serverThread that has modServer as routine.
        Parameters:
        tcpModeratorPort - the specified number of port.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - with message "Moderator socket failure" (can be thrown while initializing moderatorServerSocket).

      • broadcastGameInfo

        public void broadcastGameInfo()
        Broadcasts information about the game via network. Gets a JSONObject with information from the Game and puts in the object the current timestamp with key edu.cvut.vorobvla.bap.BapJSONKeys#KEY_BROADCAST_TIMESTAMP. Then transforms the JSONObject to a string and then to a byte array that is sent with sendBroadcastUDP(byte[]).

      • callPlayers

        public void callPlayers()
        Broadcasts message edu.cvut.vorobvla.bap.BapMessages.MSG_CALL_FOR_PLAYERS containing value of tcpModeratorPort.
